name: Woodlawn House Killarney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Came in from the states and didn't know what to expect....but what a delightful surprise. This is such a lovely place. It is very home like. Traveling with two other friends and we all had a beautiful stay at this B&B. The rooms were clean, nicely decorated...and very comfortable. Amenities are available.....including a spa services. The hostess was very helpful and friendly....and quite the cook. The breakfast in the morning was remarkable. It is centrally located. The view from our bay window was awesome...and we sat in the window drinking tea on one rainy afternoon and still felt like we were doing something special. I felt so much at home here that when I return to Ireland with my family, we will stay here. Thank you Ciara!!
reviews.title: One of the best times ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: due to a past job i have stayed in a lot of places in the area and have to say i was very very pleased !!!! the staff were Excellent and the room was perfect !
reviews.title: a hidden gem amoung choas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this little gem is in the perfect place as you only have a 10 min max walk to to town, the food there was Excellent and you truely feel comfortable and at home.
reviews.title: Really excellent and lived up to all our expectations, including delicious breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: i just have to say keep up the good work guys and thank you for a great weekend.
reviews.title: What a fantastic base for our weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: looking forward to the next visit there
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading many reviews on TA, my husband and I were very much looking forward to our 2 nights at Woodlawn House. Unfortunately for us, I don't think it lived up to it's reputation. The good: Rooms were large and clean. Shower pressure was better than I have at home. Location is about a 10-15 minute walk into town or to Killarney National Park. Lots of parking and breakfast was also good, when we had the opportunity to have it.....The "Not So Good": I found the hostess to be less than welcoming (but I am not even sure this was Ciara, because she never introduced herself). Upon arrival we asked if there were any restaurants open for Good Friday. She was not sure, but gave us a few names of places that were possibilities. Unfortunately, we had never been to Killarney and had no idea where these places were without a map or directions. No big deal though, as we like to explore. Next morning...breakfast is served 8-10. We arrived downstairs at 9:20 only to learn that the clock in our room was wrong and it was 10:20 and breakfast was over. Coming off our transatlantic flight we hadn't set one of our own alarms, which I know is our mistake, but I thought some cereal or a muffin would at least be offered, but no. She named some places again in town, but we still have no idea where they were. That night our sleep was terrible. We didn't notice the first night how uncomfortable the bed was in Room 19 because we were so tired, but the second night we had our worst night sleep of the whole trip. The bed couldn't have been more uncomfortable. Upon check out though, I think our hostess tried to redeem herself a bit. She actually gave us a map and some advice on which roads to take for our drive through the Dingle Peninsula. Maybe she was having a bad couple days, but I will say that there are 20+ B&B's on Muckross Rd on the way into town that would have had more comfort and service for the same cost.
reviews.title: I don't know if it should be rated #2 in Killarney...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ciara Roche and her staff made our stay comfortable from the moment we made our reservations. We heard back immediately on-line that they didn't have exactly what we were looking for but let us know what was available -which would worked just fine . We appreciated they let us know the options still available (we booked last minute) and they could have decided to accept our reservation and surprise us when we showed up that one of the rooms had a bathroom across the hall. Since we knew up front and it was available to only our family to use that worked out just fine. We needed a room with 3 twin beds along with a double room.
reviews.title: Comfortable and welcoming guest house to enjoy Killarney National Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ciara welcomed us on our arrival from our walk from the Killarney train station - about a 10 minute walk through Killarney to the edge of town - near the road to walk about 1 mile out to the Killarney National Park. She recommended the most efficient way to spend our afternoon to get in as much of the park as possible and also take a cab later out to Muckross Estate and Muckross Abbey.... which was about an 8 minute cab ride to the Abbey and then walked over to the Estate through the woods...off season so the Estate tour was not available....Ciara let us know that in advance too.
reviews.title: It Doesn't Get Better Than This!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were clean and cozy and the breakfast area was large, warm and friendly, great food, and quick service. They also made time during the busy breakfast rush to assist us in making reservations for our next stop in Dingle with B&B reservations and recommendations for restaurants and pubs - that we took her up on.
reviews.title: Nice B&B in Killarney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and above-and-beyond helpful with anything we needed. Ciara and her sister, Cliona, helped us with everything from booking tours, to making recommendataions and reservations at local restaurants, to making sure we had breakfast the morning of our extremely early flight. The location was perfect...just a 5 minute walk into downtown Killarney (or a 5 Euro taxi ride if there's a downpour!). The breakfast is amazing - made fresh and hot to order. They even have spa services available. For all that you get at Woodlawn House the price is an absolute steal. I'd wholeheartedly recommend this place to anyone who's spending time in Southwest Ireland!
reviews.title: A real bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Woodlawn House for 3 nights in May 2010 during the Rally of the Lakes weekend, so we feel we got a reasonable feel for the place
reviews.title: Good Quality B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B has been bought by it's current owner Ciara about a year ago and by all accounts she and her sister have really turned this B&B into a real winner.
reviews.title: What a fantastic B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The B&B has several rooms (approx 15) It is located above 6-8 minutes walk from the main street in the town, and they have FREE WI FI.
reviews.title: made me feel so comfortable and welcome it was just like home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 106 which was situated directly above the dinning room at the front of the house. I have posted some pics for you to have a look at the room. It was immaculately clean and reasonably decorated (Ciara is currently putting her own touch on the place but some of the flowery patterns are still lingering but I sure not for much longer)
reviews.title: Great B&B, great hosts, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was good and made freshly to order. There was a selection of cereals, juice, yogurts and then the cooked breakfast the usual egg bacon sausages etc.
reviews.title: home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is the best B&B we have ever stayed in, everyone is so friendly, the rooms are a great size all with en-suite, the on site tranquility room is great for added relaxation, the breakfast was beautiful (try the scrambled eggs) and its perfect location and views are out of this world, the town centre and INEC are only a 5 minute walk away, its just of the main road so its really peacefull we are already booking our next trip and are definetly going to stay here and cant wait to get back.
reviews.title: amazing place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of days over New Year. Ideal for INEC and town centre. Very friendly service, spacious rooms and a great breakfast in the mornings. Great hot powerful shower (must agree however with previous comment re clingy shower curtain). Will be my first choice for Killarney from now on.
reviews.title: Pefect location, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Lovely big rooms,. very clean and comfortable. Fab hot powerful shower (though the shower curtain was a pain attacking me whilst showering!)
reviews.title: Recomended for business or leisure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great breakfast - I had the 'special' scrambled eggs with smoked salmon - delish!.
reviews.title: Feels like at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Free wireless internet access in public areas (but I had full reception in my room at the front of the house).
reviews.title: Cozy, warm - feels like home!

description: The recently renovated Woodlawn House is a unique 14 bedroom family-run luxury guesthouse. Less than a 5 minute stroll into Killarney town yet within walking distance of all local attractions. Spacious en-suite bedrooms, extensive choice of sumptuous breakfast items,free on-site parking, free WIFI & tranquility holistic & beauty suite. Specializing in family vacations, romantic getaways, value breaks and golfing & walking holidays. With our unique blend of style & comfort and a friendly & relaxing ambiance you will always be guaranteed a warm Irish welcome every time you visit the Woodlawn guest house, Killarney.
